intro: Brachystelma undulatum, commonly known as the undulating stone orchid, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, segmented stems. It typically blooms in spring, producing pink or purple flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a sought-after species among succulent collectors.
